meanings.definition: A loud, resonant metallic sound or series of sounds.
meanings.sent1: The clang of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith's hammer produced a loud clang on the anvil.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clang of pots and pans startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The clang of the alarm clock shattered the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent5: The clang of the cymbals added excitement to the music performance.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, resonant metallic sound.
meanings.sent1: The metal pipes clang together in the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: When you hit the metal with a hammer, it will clang.
meanings.sent3: The old radiator would clang loudly whenever the heat turned on.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to clang in her chest as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The knight's sword would clang against his shield in battle.

meanings.sent1: The clang of the car crash could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The sudden clang of the door slamming made everyone jump.
meanings.sent3: The clang of the garbage truck woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The clang of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The clang of the metal gate closing echoed in the empty alley.
